intro: Mammillaria crucigera, commonly known as the Crucifix Mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and is covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, adding a striking contrast to its green body. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and slow growth, it is a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
